intro: Schefflera gracillima, commonly known as the slender umbrella tree, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are divided into multiple narrow, elongated leaflets arranged in a whorled pattern. It produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers followed by bright red berries. Schefflera gracillima is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to indoor conditions.
